titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Biomedical Communications, School of Medicine, Yale University, Videorecordings
Biomedical Communications, School of Medicine, Yale University, Videorecordings
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:26

did.unittitle: Biomedical Communications, School of Medicine, Yale University, videorecordings

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The materials consist of raw video footage shot between 1989 and 1992, which Biomedical Communications used in promotional and training programs. The videotapes include content concerning the construction and renovation of several Yale Medical School buildings, including the Yale Medical Library, the Yale Psychiatric Institute, and the Bass Biology Center and promotions for the Veteran's Administration Project, Environment for Health, and the John F. Kennedy Symposium. Videotapes documenting surgeries, clinical experiments and procedures, medical technologies, medical examinations, and dissections are also included.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 27-E (YRG 27-E), Records of departments, offices, programs, and projects of the Yale School of Medicine.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the materials is partially restricted. See inventory for details.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Biomedical Communications, School of Medicine, Yale University, Videorecordings (RU 848) Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of raw video footage shot between 1989 and 1992, which Biomedical Communications used in promotional and training programs. The videotapes include content concerning the construction and renovation of several Yale Medical School buildings, including the Yale Medical Library, the Yale Psychiatric Institute, and the Bass Biology Center and promotions for the Veteran's Administration Project, Environment for Health, and the John F. Kennedy Symposium. Videotapes documenting surgeries, clinical experiments and procedures, medical technologies, medical examinations, and dissections are also included.
